metadata.name: Hysterectomy
metadata.typical_age_group: 30-60 years most common, but can occur at any age

vaginal_laparoscopic_robotic.note: Often performed as day-care surgery with discharge within 24 hours

red_flags.pattern: Laparoscopic hysterectomy with hospital stay >3 days without complications
red_flags.explanation: Minimally invasive procedures typically 1-2 day stay
red_flags.action: Query for documented complications or medical justification

red_flags.pattern: Extended stay >5 days for any hysterectomy without documented complications
red_flags.explanation: Even complex cases typically discharge within 5 days
red_flags.action: Investigate potential billing fraud or quality of care issues

government_cghs_rate.note: CGHS laparoscopic rates based on 3-day stay assumption

clinical_criteria: Confirmed cancers of uterus, cervix, or ovaries
documentation_must_include: Histopathology report confirming malignancy or pre-malignancy

primary_indications.indication: Symptomatic uterine fibroids refractory to conservative treatment
clinical_criteria: Severe bleeding causing anemia not controlled by medication
Pain or pressure symptoms affecting quality of life
Large fibroids (uterus ≥14 weeks size) causing complications
Failed medical therapy for at least 3-6 months
documentation_must_include: Ultrasound report showing fibroid size and location
Documentation of failed conservative treatment (medication records)
Patient symptom diary or functional impact assessment

primary_indications.indication: Abnormal Uterine Bleeding (AUB) refractory to treatment
clinical_criteria: Significant impact on quality of life
documentation_must_include: Documentation of at least 3-6 months failed medical therapy
Hemoglobin levels showing anemia if applicable

clinical_criteria: Lesser degrees with significant functional impairment
Failed conservative management (pessary, pelvic floor exercises)
documentation_must_include: Clinical examination notes documenting prolapse grade

clinical_criteria: Debilitating pain when fertility no longer desired

insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Not a surgical indication; treatable with medication

insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: Undiagnosed pelvic pain without confirmed pathology
insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Requires thorough investigation; hysterectomy not first-line
Does not meet threshold for surgical intervention

insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: First or second degree prolapse without functional impact
insufficient_justifications.why_inadequate: Conservative management should be tried first
insufficient_justifications.insurer_likely_response: Reject; request evidence of failed conservative therapy

insufficient_justifications.typical_presentation: Request for hysterectomy solely for sterilization

essential_elements.format: Age in years, menopausal status, parity
essential_elements.weak_if: Age not documented or reproductive counseling missing

essential_elements.element: Second specialist opinion (for age <40, benign conditions)
essential_elements.format: Consultation note from another qualified gynaecologist
essential_elements.example: Reviewed by Dr. X on DD/MM/YYYY; concurs with hysterectomy indication
essential_elements.weak_if: Missing for patient <40 with benign condition - MANDATORY per ICMR/Supreme Court
essential_elements.regulatory_requirement: Supreme Court directive and ICMR guidelines

essential_elements.format: Medication prescriptions, duration, response for minimum 3-6 months
essential_elements.example: Trial of tranexamic acid 500mg TDS for 6 months - inadequate response; Trial of Mirena IUD for 4 months - failed
essential_elements.weak_if: No evidence of attempting non-surgical options for benign conditions

essential_elements.format: Ultrasound report with specific measurements and findings
essential_elements.example: TVS showing bulky uterus 14x10x12cm with multiple intramural fibroids, largest 8cm

essential_elements.format: Pre-op endometrial biopsy for AUB; Post-op HPE report
essential_elements.example: Pre-op: Proliferative endometrium, no malignancy; Post-op: Leiomyoma uteri, chronic endometritis
essential_elements.weak_if: Missing endometrial biopsy for AUB cases; Post-op HPE showing normal tissue contradicting pre-op diagnosis

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Hemoglobin <10 g/dL indicates anemia requiring treatment
mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: Cannot assess anemia severity or fitness for surgery

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Must document uterine size, endometrial thickness, adnexal masses
mandatory_preoperative.documentation: Detailed report with measurements in cm, pathology description
mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: Cannot confirm diagnosis or plan surgical approach

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Must be negative or addressed if abnormal
mandatory_preoperative.documentation: Cervical cytology report within last 12 months

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Mandatory for abnormal bleeding, especially if age >40 or thickened endometrium
mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: HIGH RISK - Cannot rule out endometrial cancer in AUB cases
mandatory_preoperative.when_mandatory: All AUB cases, postmenopausal bleeding, endometrial thickness >12mm

mandatory_preoperative.threshold: Mandatory for age >40 or with co-morbidities

mandatory_preoperative.red_flag_if_missing: CRITICAL - Risk of operating on pregnant patient

optional_situational.when_indicated: Suspected submucous fibroids, polyps, or intrauterine pathology
Complex cases, large fibroids, suspected deep infiltrating endometriosis, pre-operative mapping
AUB cases with suspected thyroid dysfunction

unnecessary_tests.why_unnecessary: Not diagnostic for benign conditions; may be falsely elevated
MRI or ultrasound preferred for gynae pathology

overtreatment_schemes.how_detected: Primary diagnosis does not warrant hysterectomy
red_flag_indicators: Diagnosis: Leucorrhoea/white discharge as primary indication
Diagnosis: Non-specific pelvic pain without pathology
Small fibroids <5cm without symptoms
No documentation of conservative treatment trial
Patient age <35 without second opinion
Post-op histopathology shows normal/unremarkable tissue
overtreatment_schemes.typical_scenario: Young woman in rural area with minor complaint, fear tactics used, immediate surgery without proper workup
overtreatment_schemes.action: HIGH RISK FWA FLAG - Deny claim; report to authorities
overtreatment_schemes.prevalence: Documented epidemic in parts of India per research

red_flag_indicators: Pre-op diagnosis: Severe fibroids; Post-op HPE: Normal uterus or minimal pathology
Pre-op diagnosis: Endometrial hyperplasia; Post-op HPE: Normal endometrium
Specimen discarded/not sent for histopathology (to avoid verification)
overtreatment_schemes.action: HIGH RISK FWA FLAG - Full claim denial; fraud investigation

billing_fraud_schemes.how_detected: Cross-check operative notes with billed procedure
red_flag_indicators: Billing for laparoscopic but operative notes describe abdominal approach
Billing for robotic but no documentation of robotic system use
Hospital stay >3 days inconsistent with claimed laparoscopic approach
billing_fraud_schemes.action: Downgrade to appropriate procedure code; recover overpayment

billing_fraud_schemes.how_detected: Separate charges for procedures included in hysterectomy package
red_flag_indicators: Separate billing for bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy without separate indication
Separate billing for incidental appendectomy without pathology
Unbundling of standard surgical supplies
billing_fraud_schemes.action: Deny unbundled charges; approve only package rate

billing_fraud_schemes.how_detected: Patient <40 years, benign condition, missing second opinion
red_flag_indicators: Patient age <40 years
Benign indication
No documented second specialist opinion (MANDATORY per ICMR/SC)
Minimal diagnostic workup
billing_fraud_schemes.regulatory_violation: Supreme Court directive and ICMR guidelines
billing_fraud_schemes.action: HIGH RISK FLAG - Deny claim; require second opinion documentation; report violation

red_flag_indicators: Entire surgical bill classified as 'modern treatment' requiring co-pay
Robotic equipment charges separated and inflated
No clear documentation of technology necessity
billing_fraud_schemes.action: Clarify policy on technology premiums; audit equipment charges

consumables_abuse.how_detected: Compare billed items with procedure requirements
red_flag_indicators: High-cost branded drugs when generics available
Quantities exceeding procedure requirements
Items billed but not documented in nursing/operative notes
consumables_abuse.action: Deny unsubstantiated consumables; approve only documented items at reasonable rates

intraoperative.incidence: 1-2% in major gynae surgeries; 75% occur during hysterectomy
intraoperative.note: Higher risk with previous surgery, large fibroids, endometriosis
Rare but serious; higher risk in laparoscopic approach

waiting_periods.malignancy: Usually waived - covered from day 1 or after initial waiting period
waiting_periods.note: Waiting period one of most common rejection reasons

common_rejection_reasons.prevention: Verify policy tenure and waiting period completion
Ensure proper documentation of failed conservative therapy, severity of condition
Full disclosure at policy purchase; document onset timing
Submit all reports, legible notes, detailed discharge summary
Avoid surgery for non-standard indications; ensure proper clinical justification
MANDATORY second opinion documentation for women <40 with benign conditions

special_alerts.rural_vulnerable_populations: High-risk for unnecessary procedures; extra scrutiny needed
special_alerts.insurance_scheme_patients: Documented pattern of overtreatment; verify medical necessity rigorously
special_alerts.pattern_providers: Flag hospitals/doctors with unusually high hysterectomy rates for young women

contextual_notes_for_llm.medical_reasoning_guidance: Hysterectomy is IRREVERSIBLE. For benign conditions in pre-menopausal women, conservative treatment trial is mandatory unless life-threatening emergency. The absence of conservative treatment documentation is a major red flag. Age <40 REQUIRES second opinion per ICMR/Supreme Court - this is non-negotiable.
contextual_notes_for_llm.cost_reasoning_guidance: Wide cost variation based on surgical approach. Vaginal (₹30-68k) < Abdominal (₹41-100k) < Laparoscopic (₹70-250k) < Robotic (₹200-450k). Technology premium creates financial incentive for unnecessary advanced procedures. FOGSI guidelines recommend vaginal approach first when feasible.
common_pitfalls: Do NOT approve claims where primary diagnosis is leucorrhoea, white discharge, or non-specific pain without confirmed pathology - these are classic FWA patterns in India
Post-op histopathology showing NORMAL tissue when pre-op diagnosis was pathological is DEFINITIVE fraud - entire claim should be denied
Missing second opinion for age <40 with benign condition violates Supreme Court directive - claim should be flagged even if otherwise appropriate
Extended hospital stay (>3 days) for laparoscopic approach without complications indicates either: (a) procedure was actually open, or (b) billing fraud
The absence of endometrial biopsy in AUB cases is critical gap - cannot rule out malignancy; claim should be questioned
contextual_notes_for_llm.regional_context: India faces epidemic of unnecessary hysterectomies, particularly targeting rural, illiterate women. Insurance schemes have paradoxically increased this problem. Pattern involves: minimal diagnostic workup → fear tactics → immediate surgery → normal pathology or specimen discarded. AI system must be highly sensitive to weak indications and missing safeguards.
contextual_notes_for_llm.regulatory_framework: Supreme Court mandated second opinion for women <40. ICMR guidelines specify clear indications. FOGSI recommends vaginal approach first-line. These are not just guidelines but legal/regulatory requirements in India.
